Ha, same here! Did you use the actual DEC-made machines, or were they Russian-made SM-4s?

DEC-made hardware (boards), locally assembled into a "locally produced minicomputer"

comments.html: Nice! We had to do with clones (with associated quality issues). SM-4 was a clone of 11/40, according to http://www.village.org/pdp-11/faq.pages/Soviet11s.html
comments.name: Dmitri Kalintsev
